titleStmt.title: Jokes Harran

monogr.title: A Digital Dictionary of Shawi Arabic

prefixDef.p: Private URIs using the teiCorpusHeader prefix are pointers to any element in the SHAWI teiCorpus document.
Private URIs using the share prefix are pointers to audio file residing on the SHAWI network share.
Private URIs using the geo prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on a place element in VICAV Geodata list.
Private URIs using the zotid prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on a biblStruct element in the TEI export of the VICAV Zotero Group library.
Private URIs using the dict prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on a entry in the SHAWI glossary.

spanGrp.span: One day they gathered because of the thingy, in order to enjoy themselves in the region of Rās al-ʕĒn – ʕUbāde? – No, they were not ʕUbāde.
They went to have fun. They gathered, let’s say, for instance, like today me, Ibrāhīm, and you. We have gathered and want to go to whom? We want to go to Fārūq.

It is said that they went to Fārūq, to Fāruq. And they slaughtered an animal for themselves and roasted it on an iron plate. Everything was prepared this way. They had slaughtered (an animal) and started to have lunch and so on. They had lunch and when they had finished the people were still sitting around.
Anyway, they looked around waiting for the tea. We are also drinking tea; now the tea has come to my mind. They were waiting for the tea, but he did not make tea for them.

It is said that they rode a Jeep car back then. In former times they had Jeep cars. They mounted the Jeep and went back. When they had come back (they said), “Well, dude.” Someone said, “The father of so-and-so did it all right, but eventually he left it incomplete (literally: one-eyed). He did it all right, but he left it incomplete.”

One of those who was with them went back to that host and said, “Man, my friends came with me, but they critisized you as you left (your invitation) incomplete.” He said, “How come, man?” He said, “You did everything, but you did not make tea and therefore you left it incomplete.”
He said, “Let them come inside another time. I will see how, but next time I will keep four eyes on it.”
It is said that when they went to him another time he said, “Son, make tea, pour tea, pour tea for your uncle! Bring tea, pour tea, bring tea, pour tea!”

It is said that he had served tea maybe for twenty times until the late afternoon. “Drink tea, make tea!” Now they got up. When they had come back home, they said, “Man! We went and ruined our meal (literally: we played with our bread).”
Before, he made ḥamīṣt ač-čāy, ḥamīṣt aṣ-ṣāǧ for us. And when we returned home we made it (felt for us) one-eyed. Now it has become completely blind. We we cannot see anymore!”
